fields.summary: wireframe changes to instance and LB launch wizards to move user data out of advanced options

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: for example, move user data out of advanced settings.
fields.summary: refactor launch wizards based on what users use most often

comments.body:
@jenny, looking at launch instance wiz, all I see is user data moved to step 2 and summary updated similarly. Anything I missed?

I also see the summary section looks different than the launch instance wizard. I assume those should be consistent? (screenshot attached)
Work is on GUI-1476 branch. See outstanding questions and let me know what you'd like done.
I made them both match the instance wizard summary since that is in the wireframe and matches the stack wizard summary.
yes, labels in summary area should be stacked, not side by side. Thanks!
and yes, just move user data to step 2 and update summary

user data section label does not have correct class applied

I updated the wireframe because we don't need to widget label for user data since it's in its own section now, and removed the colons from the summary area labels (that part of the wireframe was super old, sorry). Can you please update the code for these things as well?
I think I've done what you asked for here (removed small userdata label, removed colons)

Good job! Small things:

* I updated the wireframe for launch more instances to just put this in the list of parms rather than in its own section. It reads better. Sorry I didn't notice this before.  See https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Launch+More+Like+This

launch instance and create launch config: 
* user data section label does not have correct class applied. Should match the other section headers. I see that you tried to match the text block in the section above, but that text block should actually just be styled as a normal text block, like we do with text blocks anywhere else, like on modal boxes for example. Can you update that as well, and make the section header look like a section header (like tags)? I am seeing things now that were wrong in previous releases but that we didn't catch then. Thanks!

The user data section header in the instance and launchconfig wizards matches the tag section header.
I also moved the user data in the launch more screen.
I attempted to change the description text for the wizards.. applies to all tab-content panels with a description defined. I could either e-mail to ask you, or submit this for you to look at.

launch more instances:
* name label is not aligned with other label (fixed in full-width work, I believe, please verify I don't need to worry about this now)
* user data label not aligned with other labels

sorry about that. I had to indicate these were 'readonly' even though they aren't to make them align with the other readonly fields. It looks like we don't have consistent spacing in our css for editable vs non-editable field labels.

k/v label placement on launch more looks good now. The radio buttons and their associated labels are spaced too far apart on launch more instances. Then we should be good! Phew! Thanks for your efforts on this one.
updated GUI-1476 branch
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1367
UX review passed, ready for code review. Nice job, [~dkavanagh]!
Punting back to make fixes suggested in code review comments
Those things have been that way for a while. I'll fix those on Monday
[~dkavanagh]: PR 1367 is good to merge after resolving conflicts and passing CI tests.
PR 1367 merged
Released in 4.2
